channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Precision-Focused Reinforcement Learning Model for Robotic Object Pushing
item.description: Non-prehensile manipulation, such as pushing objects to a desired target position, is an important skill for robots to assist humans in everyday situations.

item.title: A Short Note on Evaluating RepNet for Temporal Repetition Counting in Videos
item.description: We discuss some consistent issues on how RepNet has been evaluated in various papers.

item.title: RESOLVE: Relational Reasoning with Symbolic and Object-Level Features Using Vector Symbolic Processing
item.description: However, the Abstractor layer while excelling at capturing relational information (pure relational reasoning), faces challenges in tasks that require both object and relational-level reasoning (partial relational reasoning).

item.title: DeepUQ: Assessing the Aleatoric Uncertainties from two Deep Learning Methods
item.description: The predicted uncertainty is the least accurate for both UQ methods for the 2D input uncertainty experiment and the high-noise level.

item.title: Properties of fairness measures in the context of varying class imbalance and protected group ratios
item.description: In this paper, we study the general properties of fairness measures for changing class and protected group proportions.

item.title: FinRobot: AI Agent for Equity Research and Valuation with Large Language Models
item.description: The system is structured around three specialized agents: the Data-CoT Agent, which aggregates diverse data sources for robust financial integration; the Concept-CoT Agent, which mimics an analysts reasoning to generate actionable insights; and the Thesis-CoT Agent, which synthesizes these insights into a coherent investment thesis and report.

item.title: Enhancing Multimodal Query Representation via Visual Dialogues for End-to-End Knowledge Retrieval
item.description: Existing multimodal retrieval systems often rely on disjointed models for image comprehension, such as object detectors and caption generators, leading to cumbersome implementations and training processes.

item.title: Physics Informed Distillation for Diffusion Models
item.description: Building upon these foundational insights, we introduce Physics Informed Distillation (PID), which employs a student model to represent the solution of the ODE system corresponding to the teacher diffusion model, akin to the principles employed in PINNs.

item.title: Searching Latent Program Spaces
item.description: Program synthesis methods aim to automatically generate programs restricted to a language that can explain a given specification of input-output pairs.

item.title: Gaussian Mixture Models Based Augmentation Enhances GNN Generalization
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have shown great promise in tasks like node and graph classification, but they often struggle to generalize, particularly to unseen or out-of-distribution (OOD) data.

item.title: A Chinese Multi-label Affective Computing Dataset Based on Social Media Network Users
item.description: Chinese emotion datasets are extremely scarce, and datasets capturing Chinese user personality traits are even more limited.

item.title: Trap-MID: Trapdoor-based Defense against Model Inversion Attacks
item.description: Model Inversion (MI) attacks pose a significant threat to the privacy of Deep Neural Networks by recovering training data distribution from well-trained models.

item.title: APDDv2: Aesthetics of Paintings and Drawings Dataset with Artist Labeled Scores and Comments
item.description: Datasets play a pivotal role in training visual models, facilitating the development of abstract understandings of visual features through diverse image samples and multidimensional attributes.

item.title: Can sparse autoencoders be used to decompose and interpret steering vectors?
item.description: Steering vectors are a promising approach to control the behaviour of large language models.

item.title: Causal Explanations for Image Classifiers
item.description: However, none of the existing tools use a principled approach based on formal definitions of causes and explanations for the explanation extraction.

item.title: Conditional Variable Flow Matching: Transforming Conditional Densities with Amortized Conditional Optimal Transport
item.description: Forecasting stochastic nonlinear dynamical systems under the influence of conditioning variables is a fundamental challenge repeatedly encountered across the biological and physical sciences.

item.title: Separating Tongue from Thought: Activation Patching Reveals Language-Agnostic Concept Representations in Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we address this question by analyzing latent representations (latents) during a word translation task in transformer-based LLMs.

item.title: V2X-R: Cooperative LiDAR-4D Radar Fusion for 3D Object Detection with Denoising Diffusion
item.description: To achieve weather-robust detection, we additionally propose a Multi-modal Denoising Diffusion (MDD) module in our fusion pipeline.

item.title: VALTEST: Automated Validation of Language Model Generated Test Cases
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated significant potential in automating software testing, specifically in generating unit test cases.

item.title: MLV$^2$-Net: Rater-Based Majority-Label Voting for Consistent Meningeal Lymphatic Vessel Segmentation
item.description: Meningeal lymphatic vessels (MLVs) are responsible for the drainage of waste products from the human brain.

item.title: Multi-Perspective Stance Detection
item.description: Subjective NLP tasks usually rely on human annotations provided by multiple annotators, whose judgments may vary due to their diverse backgrounds and life experiences.

item.title: Hopfield-Fenchel-Young Networks: A Unified Framework for Associative Memory Retrieval
item.description: Associative memory models, such as Hopfield networks and their modern variants, have garnered renewed interest due to advancements in memory capacity and connections with self-attention in transformers.

item.title: Interaction Testing in Variation Analysis
item.description: In this way, the TV measure is suitable for providing explanations in the natural regime and answering questions such as ``why is $X$ associated with $Y$?''.

item.title: Deep Learning Accelerated Quantum Transport Simulations in Nanoelectronics: From Break Junctions to Field-Effect Transistors
item.description: Quantum transport calculations are essential for understanding and designing nanoelectronic devices, yet the trade-off between accuracy and computational efficiency has long limited their practical applications.

item.title: LogLLM: Log-based Anomaly Detection Using Large Language Models
item.description: Software systems often record important runtime information in logs to help with troubleshooting.

item.title: XiYan-SQL: A Multi-Generator Ensemble Framework for Text-to-SQL
item.description: On the other hand, we implement the ICL approach with an example selection method based on named entity recognition to prevent overemphasis on entities.

item.title: ScaleNet: Scale Invariance Learning in Directed Graphs
item.description: This research extends the scale invariance concept to node classification by drawing an analogy to image processing: just as scale invariance being used in image classification to capture multi-scale features, we propose the concept of ``scaled ego-graphs''.

item.title: MBA-SLAM: Motion Blur Aware Dense Visual SLAM with Radiance Fields Representation
item.description: In our experiments, we demonstrate that MBA-SLAM surpasses previous state-of-the-art methods in both camera localization and map reconstruction, showcasing superior performance across a range of datasets, including synthetic and real datasets featuring sharp images as well as those affected by motion blur, highlighting the versatility and robustness of our approach.

item.title: Energy Dissipation Preserving Physics Informed Neural Network for Allen-Cahn Equations
item.description: This paper investigates a numerical solution of Allen-Cahn equation with constant and degenerate mobility, with polynomial and logarithmic energy functionals, with deterministic and random initial functions, and with advective term in one, two, and three spatial dimensions, based on the physics-informed neural network (PINN).

item.title: JanusFlow: Harmonizing Autoregression and Rectified Flow for Unified Multimodal Understanding and Generation
item.description: To further improve the performance of our unified model, we adopt two key strategies: (i) decoupling the understanding and generation encoders, and (ii) aligning their representations during unified training.

item.title: Joint multi-dimensional dynamic attention and transformer for general image restoration
item.description: Outdoor images often suffer from severe degradation due to rain, haze, and noise, impairing image quality and challenging high-level tasks.

item.title: FM-TS: Flow Matching for Time Series Generation
item.description: FM-TS is more efficient in terms of training and inference.

item.title: Likelihood as a Performance Gauge for Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Based on these findings, we propose two methods that use question likelihood as a gauge for selecting and constructing prompts that lead to better performance.

item.title: Breaking the Low-Rank Dilemma of Linear Attention
item.description: The Softmax attention mechanism in Transformer models is notoriously computationally expensive, particularly due to its quadratic complexity, posing significant challenges in vision applications.

item.title: DPU: Dynamic Prototype Updating for Multimodal Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Extensive experiments on two tasks, five datasets, and nine base OOD algorithms demonstrate that DPU significantly improves OOD detection performance, setting a new state-of-the-art in multimodal OOD detection, with improvements of up to 80 percent in Far-OOD detection.

item.title: xCG: Explainable Cell Graphs for Survival Prediction in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
item.description: Understanding how deep learning models predict oncology patient risk can provide critical insights into disease progression, support clinical decision-making, and pave the way for trustworthy and data-driven precision medicine.

item.title: Material Transforms from Disentangled NeRF Representations
item.description: In this paper, we first propose a novel method for transferring material transformations across different scenes.

item.title: Learning Memory Mechanisms for Decision Making through Demonstrations
item.description: In Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes, integrating an agent's history into memory poses a significant challenge for decision-making.

item.title: GTA: Global Tracklet Association for Multi-Object Tracking in Sports
item.description: The proposed method achieved a new state-of-the-art performance on the SportsMOT dataset with HOTA score of 81. 04%.

item.title: Semi-Truths: A Large-Scale Dataset of AI-Augmented Images for Evaluating Robustness of AI-Generated Image detectors
item.description: Text-to-image diffusion models have impactful applications in art, design, and entertainment, yet these technologies also pose significant risks by enabling the creation and dissemination of misinformation.

item.title: Deceiving Question-Answering Models: A Hybrid Word-Level Adversarial Approach
item.description: Deep learning underpins most of the currently advanced natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as textual classification, neural machine translation (NMT), abstractive summarization and question-answering (QA).

item.title: Retrieval Augmented Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is a central component of modern LLM systems, particularly in scenarios where up-to-date information is crucial for accurately responding to user queries or when queries exceed the scope of the training data.

item.title: MureObjectStitch: Multi-reference Image Composition
item.description: Generative image composition aims to regenerate the given foreground object in the background image to produce a realistic composite image.

item.title: Verbosity $\neq$ Veracity: Demystify Verbosity Compensation Behavior of Large Language Models
item.description: 2) We reveal the large performance gap between verbose and concise responses, with a notable difference of 27. 61% on the Qasper dataset.

item.title: Interaction Asymmetry: A General Principle for Learning Composable Abstractions
item.description: Using this formalism, we prove that interaction asymmetry enables both disentanglement and compositional generalization.

item.title: Language Models as Causal Effect Generators
item.description: In particular, we define a procedure for turning any language model and any directed acyclic graph (DAG) into a sequence-driven structural causal model (SD-SCM).

item.title: Automatic Album Sequencing
item.description: To address this, we introduce a new user-friendly web-based tool that allows a less technical audience to upload music tracks, execute this technique in one click, and subsequently presents the result in a clean visualization to the user.

item.title: Mapping the Podcast Ecosystem with the Structured Podcast Research Corpus
item.description: Podcasts provide highly diverse content to a massive listener base through a unique on-demand modality.

item.title: A Stochastic Optimization Framework for Private and Fair Learning From Decentralized Data
item.description: In this paper, we develop a novel algorithm for private and fair federated learning (FL).

item.title: Large Language Models Can Self-Improve in Long-context Reasoning
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have achieved substantial progress in processing long contexts but still struggle with long-context reasoning.
